breakthroughPP.players

Class AbstractPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • breakthroughPP.players.AbstractPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player, Setting, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdvancedPlayer, AIPlayer, InterActivePlayer, RandomPlayer

    public abstract class AbstractPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player, Setting
    A player class that implements methods of the PLayer interface that all players have in common. All concrete player classes should inherit from this class. Georg- August University Goettingen APP breakthroughPP SoSe 2016
    Author:
    Haseeb Sabar Anar

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractPlayer.State
      Possible states for the turn cycle state machine of every player.

      • init

        public void init(int dimX,
        int dimY,
        int color)
          throws java.lang.Exception,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        Initialisation of the player. If the color is specified with 2 then a red player is produced and if an output object exists this is configurated for two players
        Specified by:
        init in interface Player
        Parameters:
        dimX - width of the board in x direction
        dimY - height of the board in y direction
        color - color of the player specified in Setting or 2 this instance should show the board for both players
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection with the net fails
        PresetException - if the color of the player is not 0,1 or 2
        java.lang.Exception - if another exception occures
        See Also:
        Player

      • confirm

        public void confirm(Status boardStatus)
             throws java.lang.Exception,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
        Report of the game controls on a previouse delivered move by this instance
        Specified by:
        confirm in interface Player
        Parameters:
        boardStatus - commenting on the last move which was requested from this
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection with the net fails
        PresetException - if the status of the internal board with the controls' status disagrees
        java.lang.Exception - if another exception occures
        See Also:
        Player

      • update

        public void update(Move opponentMove,
          Status boardStatus)
            throws java.lang.Exception,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        Updates this player about a move the opponent has made by reporting the move as well as the new status resulting from that move
        Specified by:
        update in interface Player
        Parameters:
        opponentMove - move of the opponent
        boardStatus - status resulting from the opponent 's move
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the connection with the net fails
        PresetException - if the status of the internal board with the controls' status disagrees
        java.lang.Exception - if another exception occures
        See Also:
        Player

      • request

        public Move request()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Asks the player for a move. Here no real implementation only checking and advancing of the state machine that represents the move cycle of a player.
        Specified by:
        request in interface Player
        Returns:
        null the correct move will be returned by a child class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • verifiyState

        protected void verifiyState(AbstractPlayer.State state)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Verify the current state of the cycle state machine
        Parameters:
        state - the expected state
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current player state is not the expected state
